snippet: The All England Club, which now hosts one of tennis’s four Grand Slam tournaments, was born from croquet, but the game of mallets and hoops now has only a fraction of the popularity of tennis.
abstract: All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club, host of Wimbledon Tennis Tournament, was founded in 1868 and originally meant for competitive croquet; tennis quickly took over, and in 1920s when club moved from its original home near Wimbledon train station to its current location, croquet became part of club only in name.
lead_paragraph: The All England Club, which now hosts one of tennis’s four Grand Slam tournaments, was born from croquet, but the game of mallets and hoops now has only a fraction of the popularity of tennis.

headline.main: Once Wimbledon’s Foundation, Croquet Now Lives in Its Margins
headline.print_headline: Once Wimbledon’s Foundation, Croquet Now Lives on Its Margins
